010package imagingbook.pub.regions;
011
012import static imagingbook.pub.regions.NeighborhoodType.N4;
013
014import java.awt.Rectangle;
015import java.util.Arrays;
016import java.util.Formatter;
017import java.util.HashMap;
018import java.util.Iterator;
019import java.util.LinkedList;
020import java.util.List;
021import java.util.Locale;
022import java.util.Map;
023import java.util.NoSuchElementException;
024
025import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
026import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
027import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
028
029/**
030 * Performs region segmentation on a given binary image.
031 * This class is abstract, since the implementation depends
032 * on the concrete region segmentation algorithm being used.
033 * Concrete implementations (subclasses of this class) are 
034 * {@link SegmentationBreadthFirst},
035 * {@link SegmentationDepthFirst},
036 * {@link SegmentationRecursive},
037 * {@link SegmentationSequential},
038 * {@link SegmentationRegionContour}.
039 * 
040 * All work is done by the constructor(s).
041 * If the segmentation has failed for some reason,
042 * {@link #getRegions()} returns {@code null}.
043 * 
044 * @version 2020/12/21
045 */
046public abstract class BinaryRegionSegmentation {
047        
048        public static final NeighborhoodType DEFAULT_NEIGHBORHOOD = N4;
049        public static final int BACKGROUND = 0;
050        public static final int FOREGROUND = 1;
051        
052        public static final int START_LABEL = 2;        // TODO: public for image generation only! check!
053        
054        protected final ImageProcessor ip;
055        protected final int width;
056        protected final int height;     
057        protected final NeighborhoodType neighborhood;
058        
059        protected final int[][] labelArray;
060        // label values in labelArray can be:
061        //  0 ... unlabeled
062        // -1 ... previously visited background pixel
063        // >0 ... valid label
064        protected final List<BinaryRegion> regions;
065        
066        private final boolean isSegmented;
067        private int currentLabel = -1;
068        protected int maxLabel = -1;    // the maximum label in the labels array
069        
070        
071        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
072        
073        protected BinaryRegionSegmentation(ByteProcessor ip, NeighborhoodType nh) {
074                this.ip = ip;
075                this.neighborhood = nh;
076                this.width  = ip.getWidth();
077                this.height = ip.getHeight();
078                this.labelArray = makeLabelArray();
079                this.isSegmented = applySegmentation();
080                this.regions = (isSegmented) ? collectRegions() : null;
081        }
082        
083        protected int[][] makeLabelArray() {
084                int[][] lA = new int[width][height];    // label array
085                // set all pixels to either FOREGROUND or BACKGROUND (by thresholding)
086                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
087                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
088                                lA[u][v] = (ip.getPixel(u, v) > 0) ? FOREGROUND : BACKGROUND;
089                        }
090                }
091                return lA;
092        }
093        
094        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
095        
096        /**
097         * This method must be implemented by any concrete sub-class.
098         * @return true if successful.
099         */
100        protected abstract boolean applySegmentation();
101        
102        public int getWidth() {
103                return this.width;
104        }
105        
106        public int getHeight() {
107                return this.height;
108        }
109        
110        public int getMaxLabel() {
111                return maxLabel;
112        }
113        
114        /**
115         * Get an unsorted list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
116         * See also {@link #getRegions(boolean)}.
117         * @return A (unsorted) list of regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
118         */
119        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions() {
120                return getRegions(false);       // unsorted
121        }
122        
123        /**
124         * Get a (optionally sorted) list of all regions associated with this region labeling.
125         * @param sort Set {@code true} to sort regions by size (largest regions first).
126         * @return The list of regions or {@code null} if the segmentation has failed.
127         */
128        public List<BinaryRegion> getRegions(boolean sort) {
129                if (regions == null) {
130                        return null;
131                }
132                else {
133                        BinaryRegion[] ra = regions.toArray(new BinaryRegion[0]);
134                        if (sort) {
135                                Arrays.sort(ra);
136                        }
137                        return Arrays.asList(ra);
138                }
139        }
140        
141        // -------------------------------------------------------------------------
142        
143        // creates a container of BinaryRegion objects
144        // collects the region pixels from the label image
145        // and computes the statistics for each region
146        protected List<BinaryRegion> collectRegions() {
147                BinaryRegion[] regionArray = new BinaryRegion[maxLabel + 1];
148                for (int i = START_LABEL; i <= maxLabel; i++) {
149                        regionArray[i] = new BinaryRegion(i);
150                }
151                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
152                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
153                                int label = getLabel(u, v);
154                                if (label >= START_LABEL && label <= maxLabel && regionArray[label] != null) {
155                                        regionArray[label].addPixel(u, v);
156                                }
157                        }
158                }
159                // create a list of regions to return, collect nonempty regions
160                List<BinaryRegion> regionList = new LinkedList<BinaryRegion>();
161                for (BinaryRegion r: regionArray) {
162                        if (r != null && r.getSize() > 0) {
163                                r.update();     // compute the statistics for this region
164                                regionList.add(r);
165                        }
166                }
167                //regions = regionList;
168                return regionList;
169        }
170        
171        /**
172         * Get the label number for the specified image coordinate.
173         * @param u the horizontal coordinate.
174         * @param v the vertical coordinate.
175         * @return the label number for the given position.
176         */
177        public int getLabel(int u, int v) {
178                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
179                        return labelArray[u][v];
180                else
181                        return BACKGROUND;
182        }
183        
184        protected void setLabel(int u, int v, int label) {
185                if (u >= 0 && u < width && v >= 0 && v < height)
186                        labelArray[u][v] = label;
187        }
188        
189        
190        protected int getNextLabel() {
191                if (currentLabel < 1)
192                        currentLabel = START_LABEL;
193                else
194                        currentLabel = currentLabel + 1;
195                maxLabel = currentLabel;
196                return currentLabel;
197        }
198
199        
200        // --------------------------------------------------
201
202        /**
203         * Find the region associated to the given label.
204         * @param label the label number.
205         * @return the region object associated with the given label
206         *              or {@code null} if it does not exist.
207         */
208        public BinaryRegion findRegion(int label) {
209                if (label <= 0 || regions == null) return null;
210                BinaryRegion region = null;
211                for (BinaryRegion r : regions) {        // TODO: inefficient, consider different data structure for regions!
212                        if (r.getLabel() == label) {
213                                region = r;
214                                break;
215                        }
216                }
217                return region;
218        }
219        
220        /**
221         * Finds the {@link BinaryRegion} instance associated with
222         * the given image position.
223         * @param u the horizontal position.
224         * @param v the vertical position.
225         * @return The associated {@link BinaryRegion} object or null if
226         * this {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} has no region at the given position.
227         */
228        public BinaryRegion getRegion(int u, int v) {
229                int label = getLabel(u, v);
230                return findRegion(label);
231        }
232                
233        // --------- Iteration over region pixels -----------------------------------
234        
235        /**
236         * Instances of this class are returned by {@link BinaryRegion#iterator()},
237         * which implements  {@link Iterable} for instances of class {@link Point}.
238         */
239        private class RegionPixelIterator implements Iterator<Point> {
240                private final int label;                                        // the corresponding region's label
241                private final int uMin, uMax, vMin, vMax;       // coordinates of region's bounding box
242                int uCur, vCur;                                                         // current pixel position
243                private Point pNext;                                            // coordinates of the next region pixel
244                private boolean first;                                          // control flag
245
246                RegionPixelIterator(BinaryRegion R) {
247                        label = R.getLabel();
248                        first = true;
249                        Rectangle bb = R.getBoundingBox();
250                        uMin = bb.x;
251                        uMax = bb.x + bb.width;
252                        vMin = bb.y;
253                        vMax = bb.y + bb.height;
254                        uCur = uMin;
255                        vCur = vMin;
256                        pNext = null;
257                }
258
259                /** 
260                 * Search from position (uCur, vCur) for the next valid region pixel.
261                 * Return the next position as a Point or null if no such point can be found.
262                 * Don't assume that (uCur, vCur) is a valid region pixel!
263                 * 
264                 * @return the next point
265                 */
266                private Point findNext() {
267                        // start search for next region pixel at (u,v):
268                        int u = (first) ? uCur : uCur + 1;
269                        int v = vCur;
270                        first = false;
271                        while (v <= vMax) {
272                                while (u <= uMax) {
273                                        if (getLabel(u, v) == label) { // next pixel found (uses surrounding labeling)
274                                                uCur = u;
275                                                vCur = v;
276                                                return Point.create(uCur, vCur);
277                                        }
278                                        u++;
279                                }
280                                v++;
281                                u = uMin;
282                        }
283                        uCur = uMax + 1;        // just to make sure we'll never enter the loop again
284                        vCur = vMax + 1;
285                        return null;            // no next pixel found
286                }
287
288                @Override
289                public boolean hasNext() {
290                        if (pNext != null) {    // next element has been queried before but not consumed
291                                return true;
292                        }
293                        else {
294                                pNext = findNext();     // keep next pixel coordinates in pNext
295                                return (pNext != null);
296                        }
297                }
298
299                // Returns: the next element in the iteration
300                // Throws: NoSuchElementException - if the iteration has no more elements.
301                @Override
302                public Point next() {
303                        if (pNext != null || hasNext()) {
304                                Point pn = pNext;
305                                pNext = null;           // "consume" pNext
306                                return pn;
307                        }
308                        else {
309                                throw new NoSuchElementException();
310                        }
311                }
312
313                @Override
314                public void remove() {
315                        throw new UnsupportedOperationException();
316                }
317
318        } // end of RegionPixelIterator
319        
320        
321        /**
322         * This class of {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} represents a connected 
323         * component or binary region. 
324         * It is implemented as an inner class to {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} because
325         * it references common region labeling data.
326         * A {@link BinaryRegion} instance does not have its own list or array of 
327         * contained pixel coordinates but refers to the region label-array of the
328         * enclosing {@link BinaryRegionSegmentation} instance.
329         * Instances of this class support iteration over the contained pixel
330         * coordinates of type {@link Point}, e.g., by
331         * <pre>
332         * import imagingbook.pub.geometry.basic.Point;
333         * 
334         * BinaryRegion R = ...;
335         * for (Point p : R) {
336         *    // process point p ...
337         * }
338         * </pre>
339         * The advantage of providing iteration only is that it avoids the
340         * creation of (possibly large) arrays of pixel coordinates.
341         */
342        public class BinaryRegion implements Comparable<BinaryRegion>, Iterable<Point> {
343                private final int label;                                // the label of THIS region
344                private int size = 0;
345                private double xc = Double.NaN;
346                private double yc = Double.NaN;
347                private int left = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
348                private int right = -1;
349                private int top = Integer.MAX_VALUE;
350                private int bottom = -1;
351                
352                private Contour outerContour;
353                private List<Contour> innerContours;
354                
355                // summation variables used for various statistics
356                private long x1Sum = 0;
357                private long y1Sum = 0;
358                private long x2Sum = 0;
359                private long y2Sum = 0;
360                private long xySum = 0;
361                
362                // ------- constructor --------------------------
363                
364                private BinaryRegion(int label) {
365                        this.label = label;
366                        this.outerContour = null;
367                        this.innerContours = null;
368                }
369                
370                /**
371                 * Obsolete - use {@link #getCentroid()} instead!
372                 * Get the x-value of the region's centroid.
373                 * @return the x-value of the region's centroid.
374                 * @deprecated
375                 */
376                public double getXc() {
377                        return xc;
378                }
379
380                /**
381                 * Obsolete - use {@link #getCentroid()} instead!
382                 * Get the y-value of the region's centroid.
383                 * @return the y-value of the region's centroid.
384                 * @deprecated
385                 */
386                public double getYc() {
387                        return yc;
388                }
389                
390                /**
391                 * Returns the sum of the x-coordinates of the points
392                 * contained in this region.
393                 * 
394                 * @return the sum of x-values.
395                 */
396                public long getX1Sum() {
397                        return x1Sum;
398                }
399
400                /**
401                 * Returns the sum of the y-coordinates of the points
402                 * contained in this region.
403                 * 
404                 * @return the sum of y-values.
405                 */
406                public long getY1Sum() {
407                        return y1Sum;
408                }
409
410                /**
411                 * Returns the sum of the squared x-coordinates of the points
412                 * contained in this region.
413                 * 
414                 * @return the sum of squared x-values.
415                 */
416                public long getX2Sum() {
417                        return x2Sum;
418                }
419
420                /**
421                 * Returns the sum of the squared y-coordinates of the points
422                 * contained in this region.
423                 * 
424                 * @return the sum of squared y-values.
425                 */
426                public long getY2Sum() {
427                        return y2Sum;
428                }
429                
430                /**
431                 * Returns the sum of the mixed x*y-coordinates of the points
432                 * contained in this region.
433                 * 
434                 * @return the sum of xy-values.
435                 */
436                public long getXYSum() {
437                        return xySum;
438                }
439
440                // ------- public methods --------------------------
441                
442                /**
443                 * Get the label associated with this region.
444                 * @return the region label.
445                 */
446                public int getLabel() {
447                        return this.label;
448                }
449                
450                /**
451                 * Get the size of this region.
452                 * @return the number of region points.
453                 */
454                public int getSize() {
455                        return this.size;
456                }
457                
458                /**
459                 * Get the x/y axes-parallel bounding box as a rectangle
460                 * (including the extremal coordinates).
461                 * @return the bounding box rectangle.
462                 */
463                public Rectangle getBoundingBox() {
464                        if (right < 0)
465                                return null;
466                        else
467                                return new Rectangle(left, top, right-left + 1, bottom - top + 1);
468                }
469        
470                
471                /**
472                 * Returns the centroid of this region as a 2D point.
473                 * See also {@link getXc}, {@link getYc}.
474                 * 
475                 * @return the centroid of this region.
476                 */
477                public Point getCentroid() {
478                        if (Double.isNaN(xc))
479                                return null;
480                        else
481                                return Point.create(xc, yc);
482                }
483                
484                // iteration --------------------------------------
485                
486                @Override
487                public Iterator<Point> iterator() {
488                        return new RegionPixelIterator(this);
489                }
490                
491                /**
492                 * Use this method to add a single pixel to this region. Updates summation
493                 * and boundary variables used to calculate various region statistics.
494                 * 
495                 * @param u x-position
496                 * @param v y-position
497                 */
498                protected void addPixel(int u, int v) {
499                        size = size + 1;
500                        x1Sum = x1Sum + u;
501                        y1Sum = y1Sum + v;
502                        x2Sum = x2Sum + u * u;
503                        y2Sum = y2Sum + v * v;
504                        xySum = xySum + u * v;
505                        if (u < left)   left = u;
506                        if (v < top)    top = v;
507                        if (u > right)  right = u;
508                        if (v > bottom) bottom = v;
509                }
510                
511                /**
512                 * Call this method to update the region's statistics. For now only the
513                 * center coordinates (xc, yc) are updated. Add additional statements as
514                 * needed to update your own region statistics.
515                 */
516                protected void update() {
517                        if (size > 0) {
518                                xc = (double) x1Sum / size;
519                                yc = (double) y1Sum / size;
520                        }
521                }
522                
523                /**
524                 * Get the (single) outer contour of this region.
525                 * Points on an outer contour are arranged in clockwise
526                 * order.
527                 * @return the outer contour.
528                 */
529                public Contour getOuterContour() {
530                        return outerContour;
531                }
532                
533                protected void setOuterContour(Contour contr) {
534                        outerContour = contr;
535                }
536                
537                /**
538                 * Get all inner contours of this region.
539                 * Points on inner contours are arranged in counter-clockwise
540                 * order.
541                 * @return the list of inner contours.
542                 */
543                public List<Contour> getInnerContours() {
544                        return innerContours;
545                }
546                
547                protected void makeInnerContours() {
548                        if (innerContours == null) {
549                                innerContours = new LinkedList<Contour>();
550                        }
551                }
552                
553                protected void addInnerContour(Contour contr) {
554                        makeInnerContours();
555                        innerContours.add(contr);
556                }
557                
558                public String toString() {
559                        Formatter fm = new Formatter(new StringBuilder(), Locale.US);
560                        fm.format("Region %d", label);
561                        fm.format(", area = %d", size);
562                        fm.format(", bounding box = (%d, %d, %d, %d)", left, top, right, bottom );
563                        fm.format(", centroid = (%.2f, %.2f)", xc, yc);
564                        if (innerContours != null)
565                                fm.format(", holes = %d", innerContours.size());
566                        String s = fm.toString();
567                        fm.close();
568                        return s;
569                }
570                
571                // Compare method for sorting by region size (larger regions at front)
572                @Override
573                public int compareTo(BinaryRegion r2) {
574                        return r2.size - this.size;
575                }
576                
577                /**
578                 * Checks if the given pixel position is contained in this
579                 * {@link BinaryRegion} instance.
580                 * @param u x-coordinate
581                 * @param v y-coordinate
582                 * @return true if (u,v) is contained in this region
583                 */
584                public boolean contains(int u, int v) {
585                        return BinaryRegionSegmentation.this.getLabel(u, v) == this.label;
586                }
587                
588                // ------------------------------------------------------------
589                // ------------------------------------------------------------
590                
591                
592                /* EXPERIMENTAL STUFF for attaching region properties dynamically:
593                 * Properties can be used to hash results of region calculations
594                 * to avoid multiple calculations.
595                 * Currently, only 'double' values are supported.
596                 * 
597                 * E.g. calculate major axis angle theta for region r, then do
598                 *    r.setProperty("angle", theta);
599                 * and subsequently
600                 *    double theta = r.getProperty("angle");
601                 */
602                
603                private Map<String, Double> properties = null;
604                
605                /**
606                 * Sets the specified property of this region to the given value.
607                 * @param name Chosen name of the property.
608                 * @param val Value associated with this property.
609                 */
610                public void setProperty(String name, double val) {
611                        if (properties == null) {
612                                properties = new HashMap<String, Double>();
613                        }
614                        properties.put(name, val);
615                }
616                
617                /**
618                 * Retrieves the specified region property. 
619                 * {@link IllegalArgumentException} is thrown if the property 
620                 * is not defined for this region.
621                 * 
622                 * @param name The name of the property.
623                 * @return The value associated with the specified property.
624                 */
625                public double getProperty(String name) {
626                        Double value;
627                        if (properties == null || (value = properties.get(name)) == null) {
628                                throw new IllegalArgumentException("Region property " + name + " is undefined.");
629                        }
630                        return value.doubleValue();
631                }
632                
633                /**
634                 * Removes all properties attached to this region.
635                 */
636                public void clearProperties() {
637                        properties.clear();
638                }
639
640        }
641
642}
